meanings.definition: A building or structure that is highly flammable and likely to catch fire easily.
meanings.sent1: The old warehouse was a firetrap waiting to ignite.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house was a known firetrap in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The fire department warned everyone to stay away from the firetrap building.
meanings.sent4: The dry forest in summer was like a firetrap ready to burst into flames.
meanings.sent5: The firetrap factory was a disaster waiting to happen.

meanings.definition: A dangerous or hazardous situation that is at risk of causing a fire.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the candles unattended is a firetrap in the making.
meanings.sent2: The cluttered garage was a potential firetrap due to all the flammable materials.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cook while distracted can turn your kitchen into a firetrap!
meanings.sent4: The faulty wiring in the house was a hidden firetrap waiting to spark.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting fire safety measures can turn any home into a firetrap.
